p: For scenarios with unlimited ignitions, consumed C directly reflects TAB increasing sharply in the mid 20 th c. and then decreasing. This pattern is further reflected in NBP which decreases and increases with TAB. By the end of the 21 st c., NBP is close to 0 g C m -2 yr -1 for scenarios with unlimited ignitions and with CO 2 fertilization, indicating a possible equilibrium in carbon dynamics. However, for FF-NCE, NBP remains negative, indicating further C losses. For SF-WCE, consumed C and NBP also reflect TAB, with consumed C greater than that for unlimited-ignitions scenarios in the early 20 th c. and less during the mid and late 21 st c.
